column1: # SOURCE: Synthetic data for community agri-PV model
# DESCRIPTION: Farm profile types defining economic behavior and farm characteristics for 20-farm community
# LOGIC: Moderate farms represent average community members
# ASSUMPTIONS: Total farmland sums to 500 ha when farms are instantiated using these profiles
# ASSUMPTIONS: Mean farm sizes designed so 8*20 + 8*25 + 4*35 = 500 ha total
# ASSUMPTIONS: Starting capital reflects small-scale farming in Egyptian context
# CURRENCY_NOTE: All monetary values in USD (2024 basis)

column8: Low risk tolerance - prefers proven technologies and traditional practices. Slow technology adopters. Prioritizes stability over potential gains. Will wait to see neighbors succeed before adopting new methods.
Medium risk tolerance - open to gradual improvements and community-supported initiatives. Follows early adopters after seeing initial success. Balances innovation with caution.
High risk tolerance - early adopters willing to experiment with agri-PV and new crop varieties. Larger farms with more capital buffer. Likely to pilot new technologies for the community.
